Lansbury was appointed a Dame Commander of the Order of the British Empire (DBE) by Queen Elizabeth II in 2014, recognizing her contributions to the performing arts.

Personal Life

Lansbury married producer Peter Shaw in 1949 and remained married until his death in 2003. She had three children, daughters Isla and Deirdre, and a son, Peter. Her daughter Isla is also an actress and singer.

Lansbury passed away on October 11, 2022, at the age of 96, leaving behind a legacy as one of the most beloved and respected actresses of her time. Her remarkable career and captivating performances will continue to delight audiences for generations to come.

text:
It's never too late to learn more about the legendary Angela Lansbury!

Angela Brigid Lansbury CBE (born October 16, 1925) is a British-American actress and singer with an impressive 80-year career in the entertainment industry. Born in Regent's Park, London, to a family of artists, Lansbury began her acting career on stage and screen at a young age.

She made her film debut in 1944 with a small role in "Gaslight," opposite Ingrid Bergman and Charles Boyer. Her early success led to more significant roles in films like "National Velvet" (1944), "The Picture of Dorian Gray" (1945), and "The Manchurian Candidate" (1962).

Lansbury's breakthrough came in the 1960s with her iconic role as Mame Dennis in the Broadway production of "Mame" (1966), earning her a Tony Award nomination. She went on to star in numerous stage productions, including "Dear World" (1969), "Gypsy" (1974), and "Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street" (1979), for which she won a Tony Award.

In the 1980s, Lansbury gained widespread recognition for her starring role as mystery novelist Jessica Fletcher in the popular TV series "Murder, She Wrote" (1984-1996). The show's success propelled her to international stardom, earning her multiple Emmy nominations.

Throughout her career, Lansbury has received numerous accolades, including five Academy Award nominations, four Golden Globe Awards, and a BAFTA Fellowship. She has also been honored with a Kennedy Center Honor (1996), a Screen Actors Guild Life Achievement Award (2013), and a Grammy Award (2016).

Angela Lansbury is widely regarded as one of the most talented and versatile actresses of her generation, with a career spanning more than eight decades. Her dedication to her craft, impressive range, and enduring charm have captivated audiences worldwide, making her a beloved figure in the entertainment industry.
